Description: Event date in MM/DD/YY format
Name of the county where the event occurred
Measured wind speed (knots)
Wind speed converted to miles per hour (mph)
Named location where event began
Local/known time the event started
Number of direct fatalities caused by the event
Number of direct injuries caused by the event
Estimated property damage (in dollars)
Estimated crop damage (in dollars)
Timezone abbreviation for the event area
Type of measured magnitude (EG, MG, E, etc.)
Identifier for the broader weather event/episode
County Zone Type (C, Z, etc.)
FIPS code for county/zone
NWS Weather Forecast Office identifier
Number of indirect injuries
Number of indirect fatalities
Source of the storm/wind measurement
Cause of any flood event (if applicable)
Tornado path length (in miles) if tornado event
Tornado maximum width (in yards) if tornado event
Distance from a reference point at event start
Compass azimuth at event start (N, NE, SSW, etc.)
Distance from a reference point at event end
Compass azimuth at event end (N, NE, SSW, etc.)
Named location where event ended
Local/known time the event ended
Latitude of the event start point
Longitude of the event start point
Latitude of the event end point
Longitude of the event end point
Narrative text describing the specific event
Narrative text describing the broader weather episode
Example: A strong cold front moved through...
